node.title: Leonardo DiCaprio and Sean Penn Party at Art Basel
node.alt: Loewe held a party at Twist, a gay club in South Beach.
node.description: Loewe took over Twist, Superblue held a concert and CORE auctioned off art.
node.content: ["Drag queens channeling Britney Spears. A group selfie with Sean Penn. Singing along with Alicia Keys. The tropical bacchanal of art fairs, private dinners and A-list parties known as Art Basel Miami Beach has returned with a vengeance. Here are some highlights from Wednesday night.", "Loewe, the Spanish fashion brand, took over Twist, a sprawling gay club in South Beach, where partygoers danced, drank and kiki\u2019d well past 5 a.m.", "Occasion: Loewe and Gayletter, a queer culture magazine, celebrated a new book of paintings by Florian Krewer.", "The Room: Twist is a maze of seven interconnected bars, some featuring drag shows, dance floors and shirtless male go-go dancers who offer lap dances.", "In Attendance: Jonathan Anderson, the creative director of Loewe; Ricky Martin; the actor Josh O\u2019Connor; the actor Ansel Elgort; the actress Hari Nef; the drag queen Gigi Goode; the gallerist Lucas Zwirner; and Tom Jackson and Abi Benitez of Gayletter.", "The Mood: \u201cToday is my birthday and my mother just flew in,\u201d Ms. Goode, a star of \u201cRuPaul\u2019s Drag Race,\u201d said a bit after midnight. \u201cWe\u2019re going to be spending the day at the art fair.\u201d Did she know it was Britney Spears\u2019s birthday, too? \u201cYes!\u201d she said, adding that on Saturday she\u2019d be throwing a Britney-themed party at House of Avalon in Los Angeles. \u201cI\u2019m doing \u2018(You Drive Me) Crazy,\u2019 and I\u2019ve been practicing my choreography in my hotel room,\u201d she said.", "Leonardo DiCaprio got to Miami late and did not show up to a fund-raiser where he\u2019d been expected until 10:45 p.m., after the auction and dessert. But that did not dampen spirits at the 175-person dinner for c, a charity started by Sean Penn and Ann Lee to help Haiti and other Latin American countries.", "Occasion: The rare benefit party at Art Basel, which raised $1.6 million on Wednesday night.", "The Room: A giant tent erected on the beach in front of the Soho Beach House, with about 20 burlap-covered dinner tables.", "In Attendance: Mr. Penn, his daughter Dylan Penn, Mr. DiCaprio, Mark Anthony, Antoine Arnault, Delphine Arnault, Serena Williams, Craig Robins and Alan Faena.", "The Food. Family-style plates of burrata, tuna tartare, meatballs, rigatoni, grilled branzino and beef tenderloin.", "Moment of the Night: Reka Nyari, a photographer, auctioned off a selfie with the night\u2019s V.I.P.s that was turned into an NFT. It sold for $200,000. And this was before Mr. DiCaprio showed up, in a black baseball cap and large gray mask.", "The Mood: \u201cI collect one artist named Gottfried Helnwein, simply because I came onto it before it cost too much,\u201d Mr. Penn said. \u201cI\u2019m always doing movies that I want to do, that therefore pay less than my colleagues\u2019. I\u2019m an appreciator, but I\u2019m not as sophisticated of an appreciator like Leo DiCaprio, who really puts his time into this.\u201d", "Superblue, the immersive art center started by Pace Gallery and Laurene Powell Jobs\u2019s Emerson Collective, introduced itself to the Art Basel crowd with a meditative concert by Alicia Keys. Before she performed, guests slipped on bootees and spent two hours winding their way through a mirrored James Turrell installation that seemed tailor-made for selfies.", "Occasion: The invitation read: \u201cone-night-only experiential performance by Alicia Keys interweaving music, meditation, movement, art and technology.\u201d", "The Room: The 50,000-square-foot warehouse space featured an upside floral installation by DRIFT, as well as exhibitions created by Mr. Turrell, Es Devlin and the art collective TeamLab.", "In Attendance: About 600 art-world insiders including Ms. Keys; the art collectors Don and Mera Rubell (their museum is across the street); Leo Villareal, an artist; and Yvonne Force Villareal, a curator.", "Moment of the Night: Just past 9 p.m., Ms. Keys led a guided meditation before performing a 75-minute set that included older hits like \u201cEmpire State of Mind\u201d and \u201cGirl on Fire,\u201d with songs from her upcoming album, \u201cKeys.\u201d"]
